alert.note: Alert for Crittenden; Lee; Phillips; St. Francis (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 4:40AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Lee, southeastern St. Francis, east central Phillips, south central Crittenden, western DeSoto, northeastern Coahoma, Tunica, western Tate, northern Quitman and northwestern Panola Counties through 515 AM CDT... At 439 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hughes to 6 miles north of Dundee to Kings. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southaven, Horn Lake, Clarksdale, Hernando, Hughes, Helena-West Helena, Coldwater, Jonestown, Friars Point, Walls, Tunica, Crenshaw, Sledge, Horseshoe Lake, Lake Cormorant, Strayhorn, Pleasant Grove, Eudora, Dubbs and Brickeys. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for eastern Arkansas...northwestern Mississippi...and west Tennessee.
